tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE PrisonOvercrowding (
    prison_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    prison_name VARCHAR(50),
    capacity INT,
    current_population INT,
    date_updated DATE
);

CREATE TABLE Prisoners (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
name VARCHAR(50),
age INT,
crime VARCHAR(100),
entry_date DATE,
release_date DATE);

CREATE TABLE PrisonCells (cell_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
prisoner_id INT,
cell_capacity INT,
cell_type VARCHAR(50),
cell_status VARCHAR(20),
FOREIGN KEY (prisoner_id) REFERENCES Prisoners(id));

CREATE TABLE Prisoners (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(50),
  age INT,
  sentence_length INT,
  cell_number INT
);

CREATE TABLE Prisoners (
    prisoner_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50),
    age INT,
    crime VARCHAR(100),
    sentence_length INT
);

CREATE TABLE Prison_Stats (
    statistic_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    date DATE,
    total_prisoners INT,
    total_cells INT,
    overcrowding_rate FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE Prisoners (
  prisoner_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(255),
  age INT,
  sentence_start_date DATE,
  sentence_length INT,
  cell_number INT
)

CREATE TABLE PrisonOfficers (
  officer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(255),
  rank VARCHAR(100),
  shift_start TIME,
  shift_end TIME
)

CREATE TABLE PrisonCells (
  cell_number INT PRIMARY KEY,
  capacity INT,
  availability BOOLEAN,
  cell_type VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE PrisonVisitors (
  visitor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  prisoner_id INT,
  visitor_name VARCHAR(255),
  visit_date DATE,
  relationship VARCHAR(100)
)

CREATE TABLE PrisonIncidents (
  incident_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  prisoner_id INT,
  incident_type VARCHAR(100),
  incident_date DATETIME,
  description TEXT
)
